english: They speak / were speaking (used with Kaanu)
I speak / to speak (used after Abgha/Ma li khilq)
To talk to someone / tell (Root/Infinitive - more one-sided)
To call / connect (Past I form / Root)
To go / went (Past I form / Root)
To be able / can (I form / Root)
To cut / go out (Past feminine form / Root)
To look for (You form / Root - idiomatically)
I walk / to walk (used after Taliʿ/Rayiḥ)
To walk casually / stroll (We form / Root)
It is possible for us / we can (Verb + us object pronoun)
To make it / catch (We form / Root)
I know him / used to know him
type: Present (I + him object pronoun - used in Past Habitual)

english: To think / calculate (Past I form / Root)
To call / knock (Past You form / Root)
To start (Past I form + object pronoun / Root)
To care / pay attention (I form / Root)
To pass by (Past I form / Root)
To process / realize (Past I form / Root)
To sit (Past We form / Root - used for continuous)
To be happy / have fun (Past I form / Root)

type: Past (You masculine singular + me object pronoun)

notes: Colloquial negation of a present verb
Kaanu + present verb for past continuous
Kaan + Abgha often means 'wanted' or 'used to want'
Kaan + Qaaʿid + present verb for past continuous

transliteration: Ana maa fihimt wesh tabi tiquul.
english: I didn’t understand what you want to say.

notes: Lit. "What is your opinion?" - polite suggestion

english: I can tell that... / It shows on you...
I was thinking about something else

notes: Qaaʿid + present verb for present continuous
Kaan + Qaaʿid + present verb + Lamma for past continuous

english: The place that we were in it
I'm actually going there later on
notes: Rāyiḥ (participle) used for near future intention

english: I'm on my way right now
That was the first time I ever...
I think this is the first time I...
notes: Using Aḥiss as "I think/feel" + common phrase

english: By the way, the weather today is awesome!
I'm thinking of changing my plan
Well, actually, I was thinking about something else.
How about we go for a walk?
I'm not sure if it suits us.

notes: Kaan + present verb for past habitual

english: Every now and then I visit my family.

arabic_full: لقيت أحد في المكان اللي كنا فيه
transliteration: Laqeet aḥad fi al-makaan illi kunna fih.
english: I found someone in the place we were at.
He isn’t really in the mood
They’re not very accepting of foreigners
notes: Using Kathiir to mean "very" with negation

english: And then this stranger walked up to us
She’s not very into Italian food
notes: Using Marrah to mean "very" with negation

english: I had such a good time
I had such a good time
I forgot to reply to your message.
I suddenly remembered I have an appointment.
I sent you the photo on WhatsApp.
I’m continuing the work I started.
notes: Example sentence with continuous + Illi + past verb

arabic_full: نادراً أروح هناك، بس المكان حلو
transliteration: Naadiran aruuḥ hinaak, bas al-makaan ḥilw.
english: I rarely go there, but it’s a nice place.
I in particular don’t like being late.
I want to go out a bit to change the vibe.
notes: Example sentence with idiomatic "change the vibe"

english: I’m not in the mood to talk today.
notes: Idiomatic phrase for not having energy/mood

english: The weather outside is really nice.
notes: Example sentence with Saudi adverbs Barra and Marrah

arabic_full: أقول لك شي بس لا تضحك؟
transliteration: Aqool lak shay bas laa tiḍḥak?
english: Can I tell you something — but don’t laugh?
notes: Common phrasing to introduce a slightly sensitive topic

arabic_full: مو لازم نخلص كل شي اليوم
transliteration: Moo laazim nkhalliṣ kull shay il-yawm.
english: We don’t have to finish everything today.

notes: Common phrase with Qabil Kida meaning "before"

transliteration: Aḥyaanan aḥiss in al-waqt yimshi bisurʿah.
english: Sometimes I feel like time goes by fast.
I’d like to learn to cook a new dish.
notes: Using Widdi + sequence of verbs (like infinitives)

english: I felt at ease when I was with you.
It was such a nice moment
I wasn’t really in the mood to talk.
Time flew by and I didn’t even notice.
seriously, it was a beautiful day
Let me tell you a message of pride
